subject: Personal Finance
title: Shrinkflation
description: A quick, practical guide to Shrinkflation.

hook.text: Your cereal box looks the same but now has 15% less cereal. The price didn't drop.

buildup.text: Shrinkflation is when products get smaller while the price stays the same. It's a hidden price increase.

discovery.text: Companies use it because consumers notice price increases but rarely notice quantity decreases.

twist.text: Toilet paper rolls have fewer sheets, candy bars are smaller, and chip bags have more air than before.

climax.text: Shrinkflation doesn't show up in official inflation numbers, making real inflation higher than reported.

punchline.text: Same price, less product. Inflation in disguise.

quiz.question: What is shrinkflation?
options: Products get smaller while prices stay the same
Inflation that only affects small items
